heading: Introduction
text: purpose book update NOAA Tech memo NMFS-NE-171 [1] 74 species included original paper. update include data 1992 present day. also explain methods used fit models correctly predict length weight using fitted models.Since data used predict length-weight relationships spans 30+ years assumed underlying relationship changed time. assumption questioned species. said species found getting smaller, weight, given length time passes. captured analysis.

heading: 0.1 Region of study
text: Figure 0.1: NEFSC Bottom Trawl survey sampling strata

heading: 1 Models
text:
underlying model takes form:\[ W_{} = \alpha L_{}^{\beta}e^{z_{}}\]\(\alpha\) \(\beta\) intercept slope parameters (log scale), \(L_{}\), \(W_{}\) length weight, repectively, individual , 
\(z_{} \sim N(\mu,\sigma^2)\)model assumes log normal observational error (normal/gaussian log scale). important fitted model used predict weights lengthThis model can extended :\[ W_{ji} = \alpha L_{ji} ^ {\beta_j} e^{z_i} \]
season j, j= 1, …, 4 (spring, summer, fall, winter) sex j, j = 1, …, 3 (0, 1, 2) extended include season:sex combinations. models nested can therefore tested using standard statistical methods.

heading: 1.1 Relationship between Normal and Log Normal distribution
text:
\[Z \sim ~ LN(\mu, \sigma^2)\]
\[ln(Z) \sim N(\mu,\sigma^2)\]Note distribution uses parameters interpretations different. example interpretation \(\mu\) \(\sigma^2\), normal distribution, mean variance:\[E(ln(Z)) = \mu\]
\[Var(ln(Z)) = \sigma^2\]log normal distibution mean variance :\[E(Z) = e^{\mu + \frac{\sigma^2}{2}}\]
\[Var(Z) = (e^{\sigma^2} - 1)(e ^{2\mu + \sigma^2})\]important predicting weight length.

heading: 1.2 Fitting
text:
type model natural take logs fit using ordinary least squares, since \(z_{} \sim N(\mu,\sigma^2)\)\[ ln(W_i) = ln(\alpha) + \beta ln(L_i) + z_i\]
\(ln(W_i)\) regressed \(ln(L_i)\) estimate \(\ln()\), \(\beta\), \(\sigma^2\)

heading: 1.3 Prediction
text:
Now estimate Weight using fitted model\[
\begin{aligned}
E(W_{}) &= \hat{W_i} \\
&= E({aL_i^\beta}e^{Z_{}}) \\
&= E({aL_i^\beta}) E(e^{Z_{}}) \\
&= {aL_i^\beta}e^{\sigma^2/2} \\
&= e^{ln() + \beta ln(L_i)}e^{\sigma^2/2} \\
&= e^{+ \beta ln(L_i) + \sigma^2/2}
\end{aligned}
\]common, although incorrect, see\[\hat{W_i} = e^{+ \beta ln(L_i)}\]
omitting term \(\sigma^2/2\).omitting term resulting fitted value weight biased toward smaller (weight) individuals.

heading: 2.1 Common slope
text:
Length weight data pooled sex seasonModel fit:\[ W_{} = \alpha L_{} ^ {\beta} e^{z_i} \]
\(\) individual fish \(z_{} \sim N(0,\sigma^2)\)

heading: 2.2 Seasonal slope
text:
Length weight data pooled sex. Constrained intercept common error structure.
Model fit:\[ W_{ji} = \alpha L_{ji} ^ {\beta_j} e^{z_i} \]
\(j\) season \(\) individual fish. \(z_{} \sim N(0,\sigma^2)\)
